plants.name: Crocus vernus
plants.description: A perennial flowering plant known for its vibrant early spring blooms. It thrives in temperate climates and is often one of the first signs of spring.
plants.funFact: Crocuses were historically used to produce saffron, a valuable spice, though the culinary saffron comes from a related species.

plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: An evergreen shrub famous for its beautiful, rose-like flowers appearing in late winter and early spring. It prefers mild climates and acidic soils.
plants.funFact: Camellias were named after the Jesuit botanist Georg Kamel, though he never saw the plant himself.

plants.name: Mimosa pudica
plants.description: A tropical plant known for its fast-moving leaves that fold when touched. It produces small, fragrant, fluffy yellow flowers.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round in tropical climates, including February
plants.location: Central and South America, cultivated in tropics
plants.funFact: Besides its unique touch-sensitive leaves, Mimosa pudica is considered a pioneer species in disturbed soils.

plants.name: Banksia integrifolia
plants.description: An Australian native tree that blooms with distinctive golden flower spikes, attracting birds and insects during late summer and early autumn, but can bloom sporadically in mild coastal regions in February.
plants.bloomingSeason: January to April, with peak blooms varying
plants.funFact: Banksias are important food sources for many Australian nectar-feeding wildlife species.
